lines.text: I want you to marry her, and I want my love to haunt you...to make you lie awake at night, to burn your heart, to make you sick with pain! I want you to think of me and to ache for me. I want never to see you again!
Very superior waiter. Very superior man, probably. Pity no-one will ever know.
Waiters are notoriously better-mannered than those they serve.

['Anne' can't decide which fork to use]
Work it from the outside in, Signorina.
In my opinion, most people prefer sardines to caviar because most people haven't tried caviar.
Anne Vivaldi, that's it! It's been on the tip of my tongue all night.
How cozy.
You don't dance like a debutante.
How do debutantes dance?
With stiff knees.
What interesting knees you have, Admiral. Those are knees, aren't they?
They were.
Signor Pal says that drunk I'm harmless. Sober I must be pitiful!

[to 'Anne']
How much did he pay you for that kiss?

[to Rudi]
I've known that look on your face ever since you drove my bike into a tree.
I can imagine nothing of less interest to the rest of us.

a young uniformed casino attendant carrying a platter brings Count Armalia his rather substantial roulette winnings in the form of large banknotes]
Sir.

[the Count starts to count the bills]
Do you save your money, young man?
No sir.
Or support a sick mother?
No sir.
Perhaps you're working your way through school?
No sir.
You have no ambition of any kind?
No sir.
Good. Here's an enormous tip for you. Squander it.
[Hands the attendant a large banknote]
Yes sir.
